mvector LOCAL mvector

NAME

mjo_vector_push — Append a value to the end of the vector

SYNOPSIS

#include <mvector.h>

void
mjo_vector_push(mjo_vector_t *const io_var, void const *i_obj, size_t const i_count);

DESCRIPTION

Append a value to the end of the vector. Following is a description of the arguments.

io_var
pointer to an ‘mjo_vector_t’ to append values too
i_obj
array of values to append
i_count
number of elements in i_obj

If io_var or *io_var or i_obj is nil, it shall denote an invalid argument.

RETURN VALUES

If any of the arguments are invalid, the return code shall be MJO_FAIL and errno shall be set to EINVAL.

If the vector is not resizeable or i_count or 1 + i_count is zero, errno shall be set to E2BIG and the return code shall be MJO_FAIL.

Upon success, the return value shall be MJO_OK.

November 25, 2021 OpenBSD 7.0
